channel.title: BBC News - Africa
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Francine Niyonsaba: Burundi runner sets new 2,000m world record in Zagreb
item.description: Burundi's Francine Niyonsaba sets a new 2,000m world record at the Continental Tour Gold meeting in Zagreb.

item.title: Rwandan ex-army officer gunned down in Mozambique
item.description: Police were alerted by Révocat Karemangingo of a plot to kill him, the refugee association says.

item.title: Tunisia beat Cameroon to retain men's African Nations Volleyball title
item.description: Tunisia retain their men's African Nations Volleyball Championship title with a 3-1 win over Cameroon in the final in Rwanda on Tuesday.

item.title: South Africa confident of Club World Cup hosting bid despite Covid woes
item.description: South Africa's FA believes it can successfully host Fifa's Club World Cup later this year despite current Covid concerns.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Algerian judoka Fethi Nourine and coach suspended for 10 years
item.description: Algeria's Fethi Nourine and his coach Amar Benikhlef are suspended for 10 years by the International Judo Federation after withdrawing from the Olympics to avoid facing an Israeli opponent.

item.title: Kenyan influencers paid to take 'guerrilla warfare’ online
item.description: Shadowy financiers are closing down a once democratic space on Twitter for political debate in Kenya.

item.title: Nigeria's kidnap crisis: Letters replace phones
item.description: The latest tactic to tackle kidnapping gangs is to cut off mobiles and the internet.

item.title: Ethiopia: The country where a year lasts 13 months
item.description: Five things you may not know about Ethiopia's unique calendar and cultural heritage.

item.title: The Kenyans who are helping the world to cheat
item.description: Some Kenyans try to escape poverty by helping foreign students to fake their academic work.

item.title: Guinea coup: Are military takeovers on the rise in Africa?
item.description: Despite a series of coups in Africa over the past few months, the longer trend down is downward.

item.title: The South African farm turning flies into food for pets - and maybe people
item.description: A South African company is aiming to take advantage of a new interest in protein-rich insects.

item.title: Guinea coup: Who is Col Mamady Doumbouya?
item.description: Col Mamady Doumbouya is a former French soldier who has fought in countries from Somalia to Afghanistan.

item.title: South Africa danger zone: Living in a 'hijacked' building
item.description: Pictures of squatters in a South African inner city with high levels of crime, drugs and prostitution.

item.title: Kenyan men join battle to end FGM
item.description: Campaigners say it is important that Kenyan men join the battle to end female genital mutilation.

item.title: What's gone wrong with the 'War on Terror' in Africa?
item.description: Twenty years after the US 'War on Terror' began, Islamist movements have spread across Africa.

item.title: Life at 50C: The toxic gas flares fuelling Nigeria's climate change
item.description: Joy and her family are among 2m Nigerians living within 4km of a gas flare in Nigeria's oil-rich south.

item.title: Kenya's Chief Justice Martha Koome: Tackling Kenya's corruption
item.description: Kenya’s Chief Justice Martha Koome says she is focusing on building a judiciary that Kenyans can have confidence in.

item.title: Why people in Eswatini are protesting
item.description: Eswatini is Africa’s last absolute monarchy, which means the king controls everything.

item.title: The Gambia: Why is Yahya Jammeh's possible return causing such a stir?
item.description: The Gambia’s notorious and exiled former president could be seen back in the country and possibly on the political scene.

item.title: Morocco elections: What's the one thing voters would change?
item.description: Ahead of the 8 September elections, we asked young people in Casablanca what it's like to be Moroccan in 2021.

item.title: Guinea coup: What has been the regional reaction to the coup?
item.description: Ecowas has condemned the coup in Guinea threatening with sanctions unless the president is released.
